bug.short_desc: placeholder in textfield on non native placeholder capable browsers ignore placeholder color if a non default font is used

long_desc.thetext:
I've changed some textfields to use the monospace font instead of the default font. Some of the textfields additionally have placeholders set.
On browsers having native placeholders (opera 11, chrome 19, safari 5) the placeholder text is displayed in a light grey as expected in both type of textfields, independent of the font used.
On browsers not having native placeholder support (firefox 12, ie 9) the placeholder text is displayed with the normal textcolor, being undistinguishable from normal input in the textfield.
Here is a testcase in playground which demonstrates the bug:
for trunk with the indigo theme: http://tinyurl.com/c93bbbd
for 1.6 with the modern theme: http://tinyurl.com/8aac85h
Please note that the bug only shows up in firefox 12 and ie 9 (and I suspect in all supported versions before and all other browsers not having native placeholder support).
